reviews.text: We stayed for a week in mid-March with our 3 sons on the condo side of the Austria Haus. This property has both a boutique hotel with 25 rooms and probably 15 or so 2 and 3 bedroom fractional ownership condo units. The condos overlook the river and the mountains, so they are quieter (less street noise) than the hotel units. We've rented before in Vail, in Aspen and Breckenridge and this was our favorite combination of location, condo and ski conditions!
reviews.title: Loved our stay in the condos at Austria Haus

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The condo was wonderful. Charming Austrian decor, with seemingly recently replaced furniture...really nice quality couch, chairs, dressers. We stayed on the second floor in a 2 bedroom which had a king bed in one bedroom with a full bath with two sinks, large soaking tub and shower. The 2nd bedroom had two full beds and another full bath with tub/shower. The bathrooms were beautiful, especially the master, with Italian marble tile, top notch towels and toiletries and nice updated shower with glass walls. There was a separate toilet room too...very nice. The couch in the living area also pulled out and was very comfortable (said one son!).
reviews.title: Nice Hotel

reviews.text: The living/dining/kitchen area was spacious enough for our family of five and we loved the views over the river, village and mountains. We prefer wood-burning fireplaces, but seems like no hotels/condos in Colorado put them in so the gas one created a cozy atmosphere. The building is solidly built -- we could hear no noise from neighbors on either side or above us, which was nice! There were 3 tv, one in each bedroom and a larger flat screen in the living area. Would be a nice touch if they added an Ihome or Bose music player that guest could put their Ipods into, to the room (maybe on the large piece of furniture opposite the dining table).
reviews.title: Awesome

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have to mention the kitchen! Spacious enough for a small condo, but what was remarkable to me was how nicely it was equipped. We have rented homes and condos all over the country, several in a similar price range, and I have never been so pleased with a kitchen. Even though it's vacation, we do some cooking while on a ski vacation, so it was so nice to have good knifes (Cutco!), enough and the "right" sizes of pots and pans (All Clad!) and quality dishware and silverware! The appliances were top notch too with things like a Bosch dishwasher. It was nice that they supplied dishwasher detergent and paper towels since sometimes rentals do not.
reviews.title: Exceeded expectations

reviews.text: The rest of the Austria Haus property was lovely. The lobby & breakfast areas were attractive and the staff always greeted us warmly. The complimentary breakfast included fruit, yogurts, cereal, pastries, bagels, break, oatmeal, coffee, tea, juices, Belgian waffle iron, hard boiled eggs, cold meats like ham, salami and salmon. More than adequate, though I would've loved warm scrambled eggs added to the offerings (good to have protein before a day on the slopes). One day they offered an omelet station I heard, but we slept in that morning and missed it! The breakfast was well staffed by friendly folks constantly refilling items and cleaning up.
reviews.title: Family week at Vail

reviews.text: Austria haus hotel, simply great; location, cleanliness, atmosphere, service. Training of staff is impeccable. I just wanted to stay longer. All of the good restaurant are close in walking distance.
reviews.title: part best hotel group in vail

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: the is not an in expensive place but definite value for luxury.
reviews.title: Hits on all cylinders....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is beautiful, the location couldn't be better, the staff is friendly and helpful and they serve a great breakfast. It's in the sweet spot of being less expensive than the really expensive places, but a notch above the hotels below (and priced pretty close). We stayed for 2 weeks this year. I spent some time looking at the other properties (including rooms), but I'd still pick the Austria Haus. Ask for a room on the higher floors and with a fireplace.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel, Excellent service, Excellent location.
Great place, would stay again
reviews.text: The staff at Austria Haus made our stay so enjoyable. The room was clean and very comfortable and the amenities were well worth the visit. The room was well appointed, enjoyed having a seperate tub. Breakfast was wonderful. Would definitely stay here again.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great service and clean rooms. Comfortable for sleeping and adequate breakfast. I would stay here again and request a room overlooking the creek. I didn't get to use all of the amenities. I felt that it was a fair value for the price.
reviews.title: Couldn't have been better.....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at the Austria Haus on our honeymoon in January of 2013, and the property and our time there was fantastic. Our room was well appointed with heated bathroom floors, seperate tub and shower, excellent furnishings, in room gas fireplace, ample closet space, and a very comfortable bed. The staff was extremely helpful and friendly. In addition, the property is only steps from the famed covered bridge in Vail. It is about a 5 minute walk to the base of one of the gondolas. Whenever we needed our ski equipment, we just informed the front desk and they immediately got it out of their secure storage area and provided it to us. The Austria Haus also offered a great breakfast every morning, which included both European and American style offerings. The Austria Haus also included use of an excellent spa and gym in an adjacent property. I would absolutely recommend staying at the Austria Haus and will plan to stay there again on my next trip Vail, Colorado.
reviews.title: Excellent choice in Vail

reviews.text: If you like smaller, more boutique type properties, then you will probably like Austria Haus. I agree with the other reviewers in terms of the comfort and size of the guest rooms and the great location of the property. Loved walking around Vail Village. However, their rooms are noisy if you face the front of the property as when the bars close down at night, you can hear all the revelers down on the street/sidewalk. As well, I did not feel their guest service was as great as some others have indicated. My husband and I booked a Columbine room (which had to be pre-paid due to peak season) a month before we arrived. However, when we checked into the property, the front desk clerk originally tried to check us into a Lupine room, which was much less expensive than the one we had pre-paid. Then, he asked if we would like an upgrade to a suite (as the hotel was very empty that week-end), but instead of offering it to us on a complimentary basis, he wanted us to pay even more for this "privilege". We travel a lot both for business and pleasure and frequently are upgraded to nicer rooms when we check into hotels, but never for an additional fee. Typically a high quality hotel will do that to engender greater guest loyalty and strong word-of-mouth. It seems that the Austria Haus was simply trying to make more money on a light week-end instead of offering superior guest service.
reviews.title: Comfortable property but just ok service

reviews.text: I loved it! Perfect location, great staff (Jared, Mike, and Grant). The room was comfortable with an excellent view, parking was included, great breakfast, and we enjoyed the outdoor hot tub too!
reviews.title: Loved it!!!
Very Good Stay
reviews.text: We will for sure be back. Note, the gym is small so use the sister property gym.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I arrived in Vail late Saturday afternoon and the guys at reception (Jared and Dave) were great. Arranged a competitive walk in rate and I was in the room within 10 minutes.
reviews.title: Beautiful, European feel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very nice hotel with a friendly staff. This Hotel has an excellent location it is situated at the edge of Vail Village, and is in walking distance to many shops and restaurants. The room was a decent size and was a unique and cute set up. The bed was very comfy and we had a relaxing nights sleep. Food on the property was not really an option. We wanted a late night snack but there were no food vending machines on the property we had to walk across the street to the bus station to get snacks. Breakfast was not very good everything was left out at room temperature including hard boiled eggs so we decided to have some toast and get an early lunch in the villiage. We will definitely be back, but with snacks. :)
reviews.title: Anniversary Trip

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We recently stayed the night at the Austria Haus, a quick trip to see the leaves changing. Upon arrival, they checked us in early and upgraded our room. The room was small, but comfortable with a nice sitting area and great bathroom with a fantastic soaking tub. Included in our stay was the valet parking and breakfast. Everyone working here was helpful and friendly. The breakfast had a pretty large selection of food, the smoked salmon was delicious. The location was great, it is steps from the covered bridge to Vail Village. The only downside during our stay was that the hot tub was closed for repair.
reviews.title: Delightful night in Vail

reviews.text: My brother and I visited Vail recently and had a lovely stay at Austria Haus. Everyone was just exceptionally professional, helpful, friendly, etc., etc. The room with two queen beds was just beautiful, clean, breakfast was beautifully set and yummy, very close to everything Vail, and very comfortable. I look forward to my next get-a-way to Vail and plan on staying at Austria Haus.
reviews.title: Wonderful Visit!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is our third stay at Austria Haus in Vail, CO. It has great character, serves a full and generous breakfast, and is right in the middle of Vail Center. There is an extra $20 fee for parking, which is protected by the hotel, and other amenities, such as use of the internet, pool , and workout facility. We would not stay any place other than Austria Haus. In the evening, we played cards downstairs and felt very comfortable at all times.
reviews.title: Memories forever

reviews.text: Our family of four loved the Austria Haus. The lobby was warm and inviting. The staff was exceptionally helpful. The pool was quaint and relaxing. The location at the Covered Bridge was excellent. And the room was LOVELY. We stayed in a larger room with sitting area and fireplace and it was just right for our week's trip. We took advantage of our option to swim at The Lodge at Vail one day and their pool was very nice too. Our only quibble was that there be a few more hot breakfast items on the breakfast buffet. That said, the Austria Haus will be our number one choice when we visit Vail again.
reviews.title: Loved it
